author: A_Brickset_user
title: Need swords?  Here's a wagon-full!
review: This is an excellent set, maybe one of the best wolfpack sets.  I bought one of these a few years ago; I wish I could go back in time and by out the store!  Good quality minifigs, good quantity of armory, and nice selection of pieces too.  The cart can hide a treasure chest also, and that's kinda neat.  Would have been nice to have an additional sheild, but it's still a wonderful addition to the castle theme.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: yeah....awsome
review: this set is awsome, I got it for christmas and i love it. The cool thing is that you get two guys (in my opinion 3 would have been good) and 3 swords and a kool shield!!! To make it better it should be 2 sheilds and 3 guys.

author: legotrainfan
title: Redundant to be reviewed
review:
Actually this set is redundant to be reviewed! Look at it and you will see how many weapons there are! For the weapons alone it is absolutely worth buying it! 

Some dislike the colour of the coach. I have never bothered about its colour. Of course, in the Middle Ages bandits definitely did not use blue carriages, but is it really better to have everything in gray or black? And it could be worse. The carriage could also be in yellow! ;-)

There is a hidden compartment. Just lift the upper part of the coach and you can put the treasure chest in it. An ingenious feature! The bandits can hide what they have robbed when they are controlled by soldiers. 

The manoeuvrablility of the coach is a bit limited. The horse hitching is linked with a turntable. The front wheels cannot be moved to the right and left much.

author: Novelty
title: Only Average
review:
Outside of the US, this was the smaller of the Wolfpack sets, and even for a small set it was almost medium sized.

it comes with 2 minifigures and a whole bunch of good stuff including a treasure chest AND a barrel (and another grey falcon).  There's also a whole bunch of weapons and a very cool flag with the logo.

The other good thing about this set is that there is a hiddden compartment underneath the wagon, which is hinged - lift it up and it reveals a secret compartment.  However, some compromise was made with this though and the result is that the wagon is bigger than expected, making it cluncky and hard to manuoever during play.

author: hustla187
title: A Wolfpack Army Builder
review: There were only three sets under the Wolfpack theme that were produced. The Wolfpack seemed like a small army until now! This is the set that every Wolfpack should have multiples of. You get two Wolfpack minifigures, a carraige, and alot of supplies. If the Wolfpack army is the plan, start with this set.

author: Gus_263
title: Have a lot of stuff
review: This is a wagon of the series of the wolfpacks, guys with wolf symbols in the castle theme. These don't have helmets, but helms in normally brown colors. This is a wagon featuring the blue color. This have wheels too included on carts, but this is bigger and have a horse. The playability with the minifigures are great, and riding the wagon too, not very with one horse, but this is also a feature. Is notable that it have a treasure and is easy to hide it on the wagon, with or without other pieces to make a creation. Weapons like a crossbow and a longbow don't shots, but still good, in lego style, like the swords and spears with flags on it. A piece that is included in sets with horses like in the old castle is too included also a shield The colors are great, brown wheels, black horse, and some blue is cool to many themes.

author: jairo_jeremias
title: Simplemente maravilloso
review:
Por años vi la caja en los estántes de las tiendas y en los catálogos, hasta que finalmente lo pude adquirir. La emoción fue enorme al ver las imágenes de la caja tan bonitas.

La construcción tiene un cierto nivel de dificultad para un set de su tamaño y época, con varias piezas diversas que en su época daban a este carruaje un aspecto genial. Posiblemente lo más atractivo de la construcción es el espacio interior que permite ocultar algunas cosas bajo el piso del carruaje, para pasar desapercibido en una requisa de los caballeros negros.

La gran cantidad de piezas de armamento le hacen extremadamente atractivo: 4 espadas, una lanza, un arco y una ballesta le hacen un formidable vehículo de transporte para abastecer una batalla. Le completan el barril y el baúl del tesoro.

Las minifiguras Wolfpack son muy atractivas, ambas con sus rostros importados de los sets de Piratas. El guerrero tuerto se ve muy realista para un conflicto medieval. Siempre me he preguntado si los Wolfpack son alguna clase de amigos de los hombres del bosque, que les ayudaban en el pillaje camuflándose entre los aldeanos con sus gorritos frigios, aunque la capa de plástico los delataría fácilmente. También me los he imaginado como unos highlanders escoseses. Finalmente tiene su caballo con la silla para poder armar al único caballero de los Wolfpack.

Definitivamente recomiendo mucho este set por su belleza propia de la edad dorada de los sets de los Castillos.

author: BasiltheBatlord
title: Wolfpack caravan
review:
The wolfpack series ties with Dark Forest for the smallest lego series ever. Despite this, The Wolfpack gang of theives is a very defined faction in lego castle. This set is great. It has a black horse A cart with a secret compartment, a barrel and a chest, both containing treasure, a hunting falcon, aWolfpack flag, A generic wolfpack bandit, and The guy with the eye patch, who I consider the leader of the Wolfpack faction. Not to mention  good kit of weapons: A whip, two swords, a Sheild, a bow, a quiver, a spear, and a crossbow. It gives you a good idea of what kinds of weapons are used by the Wolfpack. Minifigures:

  Wolfpack Warrior
  Wolfpack Commander

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Stealthy Wagon..In Blue!
review:
Honestly, don't believe what I write, blue made for a contrasting colour scheme here. I think for forest dwelling types, if you just came out of the Robin Hood era then Castle became near incomparable but I can't ignore the merits of this set or the Wolfpack subtheme.

Minifigures:

[··][··][··][··]

Great prints and excellent colour schemes, stubble and eye patches,? Yup, these are definitely bandits alright.

Battle Wagon
Ok so actually these folks are armed to the teeth and saying 'come and have a go if you think you're hard enough!'. They get 3 swords, a spear, a crossbow, a quiver of arrows and a bow, not forgetting a sturdy horse whip, not just for the horse! The addition of the parrot piece in grey made for a bird of prey or carrion which was an exciting new idea at the time.

The black horse is a suitable choice for the darker theme here and I love the horse yokes with their turntable and hinge, well built too. The wagon is a sturdy affair and has, guess what? A secret compartment for a minifigure to lie down in. There are few of these from Lego, my preffered one being just in instruction form in an ideas book. The best part of this solid build is the fact the front wheels turn with the horse and as its finished by a flag, themed flag, a barrel of gold and a treasure chest with treasure, it really is pretty decent.

I would award it more for achieving a build that Castle never quite fulfilled but I still feel the best of Castle was over by now and it was many years before some original ideas started to get released that were really medieval or excellent in design. Good but not best of theme.

author: Huge_Nerd
title: a classic!
review: Gotta love the wolfpack. This set had a lot of great play value. The two minifigs were very detailed for the time. The cart had tons of weapons, plenty of storage for treasure, and a hidden compartment. Villagers beware when this cart comes rumbling down the street!

author: AETerry
title: Wolfpack Renegades
review:
After Lego seemed to run out of steam for their Forestmen set, they introduced the Wolfpack Renegades. There were only a few sets put out for this sub-theme, but I'd rather have a few stellar sets then tired remakes trying to drag a theme on.

 

I've rather enjoyed this set. You get two wolfpack minifigures, a wolfpack flag and a plethora of weapons to arm them with. There's treasure and even a hidden place in the wagon, similiar to other wagons in Castle. The wagon is a solid design.

 

It was well worth picking up back in the day. I'm sure there's inflated prices now days among collectors. But the wolfpack added an element of bandits and lawlessness to a Castle theme that rivaled the Forestmen.

author: Ernst
title: Adorable Bad Guys armed to the teeth !!
review:
Overall 5 bricks : I love this Castle "mini" theme with just the 3 sets available. These predecessors of the Robin Hood merry men look more funny than evil. This over complete set is 2 of them transporting their loot and a whole bunch of weapons, probably on their way to the Wolfpack Tower. Great little playing set and a must have for Castle collectors, I must admit I have 2. For a reasonable price still (used) available.

Building 4 bricks : Great old school building with all small parts with as result a great little cart which can be opened with great possibilities to transport arms and luggage. It would have been perfect if the space underneath the loading floor had a bottom plate too. A special turntable with hinge to connect with the horse hitching. gives a great turnable cart.

Parts 5 bricks : This set gives us 2 great figures with Wolfpack torso's, a cart with horse and a sadle. You also have an eagle, a Wolfpack flag, a treasure chest and barrel and a load of weapons. Only thing you could miss here is a prisoner but not worth distracting a brick.

Playability 3 bricks : It is playable on his own but it gets real value if you add it to the Wolfpack Tower or add a Crusader or Black Knights set to it. 

Value 5 bricks : Bricklink gives an average value of some € 25,00 for this set in used condition. For a collector a reasonable price in my opinion, for a kid to play with or for parts a bit too expensive but for a Castle fan it is worth it.

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's Review
review:
Don’t panic my fellow wolves, the supply wagon has arrived and it is mightily stocked. Yes the Wolfpack see their forces grow strong with a set like this, a nice sturdy wagon design (with a secret compartment), the only horse they ever receive, a chest of gold to fund their criminal activity and enough weapons to make a quartermaster sigh (and a barrel full of whatever your imagination can think of; mine is filled with Rum).

It’s nice to see a simple idea done so well, there is enough equipment in this set to make it an instant army builder, my only problem with the set is the fact that the wagon is a hard to turn, there is little manoeuvrability in the front wheels, but I suppose that wagons from our own history were not the most agile of constructions anyway, so historically its probably accurate. Truly I can not find a reason not to love this set, my biggest problem I have with it is the fact that I only own one (I will happily take donations).

If you like this review click on the link to find it and all reviews of the Castle sets

http://legosteveblog.blogspot.com/2011/11/lego-wolfpack-sets-1992-1993.html
